oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Factor analysis to identify latent constructs across management subjects at a business school
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KUMAR, UA
SINGH, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: eigenvalue
eigenvector
correlation
covariance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Factor analysis involves the study of order and structure in multivariate data. It starts with a set of observations obtained from a given sample, analyzing this set of observation with their inter-correlations to determine whether the variations represented can be accounted for adequately by a number of basic categories smaller than that with which the investigation was started. Factor analysis is applied to identify the latent constructs in the subjects being offered at a business school. The significance of this study is to get some insight on the course design of the prevailing academic curriculum.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2007 IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON SERVICE OPERATIONS AND LOGISTICS, AND INFORMATICS, (), 357-362
